hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >90%) and BTC's 20-day realized volatility compresses below 30% while its 10-day ATR reaches a 30-day low, a subsequent 5% daily price drop below the 20-day moving average will trigger a transition to a BEAR regime within 5 trading days with 75% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression during neutral periods often precedes significant directional moves. The combination of low volatility, low ATR, and a sharp break below key support suggests accumulation of selling pressure that typically sustains into a bear regime.
entry_conditions: BTC 10-day Average True Range at 30-day low
BTC price drops >5% daily below 20-day SMA

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confirmed by model)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price reclaims 20-day SMA and closes >2% above it

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such signals fail to produce a BEAR regime transition within 5 days, or the subsequent bear regime lasts less than 10 trading days.
